Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2009 07:15AM vkeys1948 wrote: Its funny have to laugh because we (the ladies that have been where you are now) have tried almost everything to get a little comfort and/or sleep. I cut off some panty hose (not tight) and put my arm in the leg part and it really worked for me. Good luck it does get better God Bless
Posts.Title: underarm discomfort after surgery marin MarieK

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2009 03:48PM vkeys1948 wrote: Binney, Thank you for your post, I just finished all my treatments and yes everyone thinks its over get on with it. Well they just do not know how hard it is, you want to get on with it but you get tired by mid day, since I have neuropathy in my feet,as you know,hurt,  you can only walk so fast and so far. I do not sleep well because my boob still hurts, only good thing is I dont have bad hair days yet. Please  do not get me wrong I am very blessed with the result of chemo,surgery and radiation. I just want it the way it was but I think I have to find a new normal. God Bless( I also go to MDA they are great there)
